question.text: Which of the following is an incorrect statement about cannabinoids?

options.text: Cannabinoids are the group of chemicals that interact with cannabinoids receptors present mainly in the brain and gastrointestinal tract.
Cannabinoids are naturally obtained from the inflorescence of the Cannabis sativa plant.
Cannabinoids includes marijuana, hashish, charas and ganja.
Cannabinoids are generally taken by inhalation and oral ingestion, which affects the cardiovascular system of the body.

solution.text: Cannabinoids are a group of chemicals that interact with cannabinoids receptors present mainly in the brain. They belong to hallucinogenic drugs, which often make users 'see the sound and hear light'. They are obtained from different parts of Cannabis sativa plants.
